article_text: A federal appeals court panel recently upheld a Washington law that says a pharmacy business must stock and fill lawful prescriptions requested by its customers, regardless of whether store owners have religious objections to a specific medication. Owners of the Ralph’s Thriftway supermarket and pharmacy in Olympia sued in 2007 in a case that seems to have no end.

article_metadata.news-keywords: Editorial, The Olympian, Our View, contraception, contraceptives access, Washington Department of Health, Pharmacy Board, Plan B, Stormans, Ralph’s Thriftway, 9th Circuit Court of Appeals, U.S. Supreme Court

article_summary:
Owners of the Ralph’s Thriftway supermarket and pharmacy in Olympia sued in 2007 in a case that seems to have no end.
A federal appeals court panel recently upheld a Washington law that says a pharmacy business must stock and fill lawful prescriptions requested by its customers, regardless of whether store owners have religious objections to a specific medication.
